thread.title: Potential Test Opener Ali Dismissed For 22
thread.title_full: Potential Test Opener Ali Dismissed For 22

title: Potential Test Opener Ali Dismissed For 22
text:
Potential Test Opener Ali Dismissed For 22 11:25,   Share by email Potential Test opener Moeen Ali was dismissed for 22 on day one of England's game against Pakistan A. 
Moeen, vying with Alex Hales for a spot as Alastair Cook's partner in the upcoming series with Pakistan, was preferred to Hales in Sharjah in the first of two warm-up matches for the tourists. 
The Worcestershire player, who batted at No 8 for England in the Ashes, struck two fours while putting on 44 with Cook before he was caught top-edging a pull stroke off left-arm seamer Zia-ul-Haq. 
England reached 69-1 at lunch, with Cook unbeaten on 37 and Ian Bell six not out a home side featuring Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq and fast bowler Junaid Khan. 
Leg-spinner Adil Rashid was included in England's XI, with Jonny Bairstow edging out James Taylor for a middle-order berth and Mark Wood beating off competition from Steve Finn to join James Anderson and Stuart Broad in the seam ranks. 
A second two-day game later this week should see England rotate their pack, with Hales, Taylor, Finn, all-rounder Samit Patel and paceman Liam Plunkett hoping to figure. Promoted Stories
